advert.description: <br><font color="red"><strong>> PRICE LIST</strong></font><br><blockquote>This reseller advert shows the initial price list from 1982 and the new prices of June 1983, about 40% less expensive.</blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> IN SCHOOLS #3</strong></font><br><blockquote></blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> FRENCH AD #2 (1984)</strong></font><br><blockquote>"Electron, software in profusion"</blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> (FUNNY) PROMOTIONAL PICTURE</strong></font><br><blockquote>... from a promotional brochure</blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> FRENCH ADVERT</strong></font><br><blockquote>''Olivetti M10, the portable professional micro-computer, here comes why."</blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> ABORTED ADVERT</strong></font><br><blockquote>One of the aborted advert campaigns for the 8048 was "Micromania".<p class="petitgris">Thomas Fischer</p></blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> FRENCH ADVERT.</strong></font><br><blockquote>This advert was for the Serie 5 and the ACS-8000 systems.</blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> U.K. AD. (DEC. 1985)</strong></font><br><blockquote></blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> ORANGE+ US AD. (1983)</strong></font><br><blockquote><p class="petitgris">thanks to <a href="http://www.textfiles.com" target="_blank">www.textfiles.com</a> for this scan</p></blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> Z-2H 1980 ADVERT</strong></font><br><blockquote></blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> COCO CLONE ADVERT</strong></font><br><blockquote>Sampo, a Taiwanese company specialized in monitors and video terminals production also attempted to produce a CoCo clone computer, but the marketing little lasted. </blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> FRENCH ADVERT #3</strong></font><br><blockquote>"With a cool teacher, computers is a child game" <br><br> "Alice, the Basic teacher"</blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> FRENCH AD (JAN. 1985)</strong></font><br><blockquote>"Maxi Basic Yeno SC 3000 : program at full gallop"</blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> GERMAN ADVERT</strong></font><br><blockquote>This is a German advertisement for the BIT-60 and BIT-90 models. Atari VCS-2600 cartridges are scattered in front of the BIT-60 to show that the it is really compatible with the VCS-2600 ! But strangely enough, there is no picture displayed on the TV. Were these models really working ? ;-)</blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> JAPANESE ADVERT</strong></font><br><blockquote></blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> 464 - 6128 PERIPHERALS</strong></font><br><blockquote>From top left to bottom right:<br> - T.V. modulator for the CPC 6128<br> - Joystick with joystick adaptor<br> - T.V. modulator for the CPC 464<br> - Disc drive with interface and CP/M for CPC 464<br> - Speech synthesizer and stereo amplifier<br> - Additional disc drive<br> - Light pen with graphics software<br> - RS232 interface<br> - DMP 2000 dot printer</blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> FRENCH ADVERT (JULY 1985)</strong></font><br><blockquote>Page 1</blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> NORTHSTAR BROCHURE #1</strong></font><br><blockquote>NorthStar brochure, Page 1.<br> The brochure says:<br><br> <b>HARDWARE</b><br> The HORIZON computer incorporates a high speed 4 MHz Z80A microprocessor with 64Kb of Dynamic RAM including parity and two 5 1/4 inch floppy disk drives in an attractive desk top chassis. The chassis also provides a 12-slot S-100 mother board which contains a Real-Time Interrupt, two RS-232C serial ports, one 8-bit parallel port and power regulation circuitry for the integrated floppy disk drives. Either a 115 or 230 volt power supply with sufficient power for all 12 slots and the disk drives is also included. The use of high speed (200 nsec) Dynamic RAM and "fast stepping" floppy disk drives, along with the 4 MHz CPU, delivers the highest average performance of all comparable microcomputers as measured by independent benchmark studies! <br><br> <b>SOFTWARE</b><br> The power and versatility of the HORIZON computer is further enhanced by a wide range of system and application software. For business use, the comprehensive North Star Application Software Packages offer Word Processing, Accounting and Financial Reporting in either single user or multi-user versions. For the scientific, engineering, or education oriented user, North Star's powerful DOS operating system with its efficient BASIC or Pascal languages are available. The industry standard CP/M operating system is also compatible with applications packages in MicroSoft BASIC, FORTRAN, and COBOL.<p class="petitgris">Thanks to <b>Gordon Dyer</b> from England</p></blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> M5 JAPANESE ADVERT</strong></font><br><blockquote><p class="petitgris">Thanks to <a href="http://web.kyoto-inet.or.jp/people/s-oga/" target="_blank">The collection of historic PC leaflets</a> for this picture!</p></blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> U.K. AD (APR. 86)</strong></font><br><blockquote></blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> FRENCH ADVERT, JAN. 1984</strong></font><br><blockquote>Seductive Sanco computing.<br><br> Treat you to a star for less than 3,000 Euros</blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> FRENCH ADVERT #3</strong></font><br><blockquote>''God created the world, DAI put it under CP/M''</blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> JACQUARD SYSTEMS</strong></font><br><blockquote></blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> FRENCH ADVERT (APRIL1982)</strong></font><br><blockquote></blockquote>

computer.description:
The X1cs, as well as the X1ck, are derived from the X1c. They are low price models.
The difference between X1c and X1cs, is that the X1c can be connected to a 4 colors plotter/printer, whereas the X1cs has two I/O ports instead of the plotter/printer connector.
Tape Basic and Disk Basic were available but had to be loaded from tape.

item.description: Top view||||||<br><font color="red"><strong>> TOP VIEW</strong></font><br><blockquote>This original extension was at least usable with the X1 Turbo serie...</blockquote>

I/O expansion box||||||<br><font color="red"><strong>> I/O EXPANSION BOX</strong></font><br><blockquote>This box was used to multiply the input/output connectors and thus, possibilities of the X1 systems.</blockquote>
Back||||||<br><font color="red"><strong>> BACK</strong></font><br><blockquote>This extension box offers 4 I/O ports.</blockquote>
Front||||||<br><font color="red"><strong>> FRONT</strong></font><br><blockquote>This extension was used to generate titles for video-tapes, among other things...</blockquote>
Back||||||<br><font color="red"><strong>> BACK</strong></font><br><blockquote>A lot of connectors can be found at the back of the unit...</blockquote>

computer.name: X1-CS (CZ-803C)
computer.ports: 2 x I/O ports, 2 x joysticks (Atari), audio out, keyboard, printer
